section.title: Freenet Specifications
section.p: This is a difficult topic because Freenet is in fact poorly specified. There is little documentation and the developers make frequent changes to the protocols in use. One consequence is that the network is at the time of writing (mid-February 2004) split into three. Officially, there are two networks, stable and unstable, the former meant for general use and the latter reserved for developers. The networks generally are incompatible at the protocol level.

However on 8 February stable build 5066 was released; this used protocols incompatible with stable build 5065 and previous builds, and so split the stable network in two. To make matters worse, 5066 was buggy, and almost immediately replaced by stable build 5067. This introduced still more bugs, and so was replaced the next day by stable build 5068. The upshot is that there are at least three Freenet networks: the older stable network, compatible with build 5065; the newer stable network, currently at build 5068; and the unstable network, which sees new releases at least on a daily basis.

This description will focus on Freenet's protocols as of build 5065, the last version used in the older stable network. If the newer stable version settles down, we will revise the specifications here accordingly.
